channel.title: H1n1
channel.description: Way too over-hyped tbh. College just got let out for a week and a half or so. Best part? Come back right into midterm time.

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @_Sep `Sep
item.description:
@_Sep wrote:

maminerr:

free weeks off school arent anything to be scared of

Correct, but free weeks off of college is a bit different, more so when you come back straight into midterms. It’s not going to fail me, but it’s a pain in the ass.

Apparently the reason for closing it was because the president of Student Union was confirmed to have it.

Read full topic

I drink too much at the best of times, so I’m not sure what my liver is like.

So, in short: H1N1 DO NOT WANT.

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

its not even bad
you just feel like death for a few days and then feel shit for a few more after it.
i probably have the worst immune system here and i didnt die from it.
people where i lived took their kids to swine flu parties because getting the virus makes you more immune to it.
my whole state was pretty much in lockdown and named “the swine flu capital of australia” because we all had it
free weeks off school arent anything to be scared of

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @grantbm grantbm
item.description:
@grantbm wrote:

Cain_:

Cain waits for real evidence against the flu-vaccine

There is nothing wrong with the vaccine it is just that it is unnecessary for most. If you need it get it.

but 3 out of 10 of my friends who got vaccinated became sick for a day or two after.

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=412784.msg3042914#msg3042914 date=1259258396]
Cain_ ur dum. Its just a huge media-circus to make money. I have had a total of 4 people taking the vaccine and they all got sick FROM it.
[/quote]
derp derp conspiracy and anecdotal evidence derp derp

Boo hoo, a flu big fucking deal.

Ye two flus in one season, not like that’s gonna double the yearly average deaths from the flu this year.

Cain waits for real evidence against the flu-vaccine[/quote]Every single example of a death from newspapers i’ve seen happened because:
A - The person had another disease
B - The person had bad a bad immune-system
C - The person was over 60 or below 15
D - The person didn’t even die from the flu but it was portrayed that way by the newspapers

Also the fact in sweden the importer of vaccine owns 3 of our biggest newspapers makes you wonder even more.

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

My reasons for not getting the vaccine have nothing to do with the the bullshit side effects and supposed dangers.
I rarely get sick in the first place, and I have never gotten the flu nor a flu shot in my life, so getting an H1N1 shot seems like an unnecessary pain in the ass. If I die from H1N1, feel free to tell my dead body “I told you so”, I still won’t give a shit.

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

i had swine flu a week ago. to be honest, around 7 kids were infected in my grade within the same period of 3-4 days (including me), and even then my school didnt close down

its as bad as the regular flu. with me, i had fucking horrible nausea, cough and fever. but thats it

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“PeterMan, post:7, topic:316206”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=412784.msg3041808#msg3041808 date=1259175911]
i have it right now. ask me anything.
[/quote]
Is your anal bleeding more now or is it still bleeding moderate?[/quote]
hasnt bled in a few months

[quote=“Xx R A G 3 R, post:8, topic:316206”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=412784.msg3041808#msg3041808 date=1259175911]
i have it right now. ask me anything.
[/quote]

Do you have a sore throat and a cough? I’m just wondering if symptoms differ depending on the person.[/quote]
only cough and fever. most people will get cough, but symptoms vary a lot

Read full topic

item.title: H1n1
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Xx R A G 3 R, post:8, topic:316206”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=412784.msg3041808#msg3041808 date=1259175911]
i have it right now. ask me anything.
[/quote]

Do you have a sore throat and a cough? I’m just wondering if symptoms differ depending on the person.[/quote]

it does differ from person to person, quite a lot. Most people get off with it fine and just have symptoms of normal flu, but some have had much worse symptoms. A friend of mine had seriously restricted movement (might as well call it paralysis) for two days, and I’ve heard of a few people going into hospital with other swine flu related problems.

it just depends on your immune system. obv people who are always sick are more likely to develop nasty symptoms, and vice versa.

Read full topic
